ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to apply statistical techniques to a variety of problems.
Use of python to carry out statistical tests on data sets
A broad overview of classical and Bayesian statistics, and many of the modern methods for machine learning.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class did a great job in imparting knowledge regarding the application of a wide variety of statistical techniques. It could have better explained the astronomical aspects of astrostatistics.
Might be better to have fixed problem sets with known answers such that any issues in understanding the questions can be quickly addressed

Strength: The course covers a lot of material. If you can follow the course, you'll learn a lot. Weakness: It's not easy to get help even though it's a small class. Lectures are only hard to follow. There is no clear flow of what we are doing each lecture.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I learned a lot of techniques in this course, so I would recommend it.
You will learn a lot in this class, however mostly through self-teaching. If you want to know everything in stats and ML in one semester, consider taking it.
